cluster_relations.rel_desc: Social media increases the visibility of marginalized groups.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject raises the visibility, exposure, or public prominence of the object.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Marginalization, Representation & Inclusion in Social Media

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Social media promotes diversity in public discourse.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject actively supports, encourages, or increases the visibility, prevalence, or strength of the object concept, value, or activity.

qualifiers.CausalHint: has played a crucial role in

args.justification: The relation from social media to increased visibility of marginalized groups is the same general type of social influence as the other three 'promotes' relations (social media causally influencing social values, inclusion, and activism). Aligning this instance's rel_cls from 'communication_impact_relation' to 'social_influence_relation' groups all four under one coherent class of social influence/impact relations, while preserving the distinct canonical predicate 'increases_visibility_of'.

executed_decisions.justification: The relation from social media to increased visibility of marginalized groups is the same general type of social influence as the other three 'promotes' relations (social media causally influencing social values, inclusion, and activism). Aligning this instance's rel_cls from 'communication_impact_relation' to 'social_influence_relation' groups all four under one coherent class of social influence/impact relations, while preserving the distinct canonical predicate 'increases_visibility_of'.
